comments.author: Šime Vidas
comments.message: Looking at that media query, I wonder what percentage of Macs have DPR < 2 nowadays.

replies.author: Markus Stange
replies.message: Among Firefox users, that number is around 80%: https://people-mozilla.org/...

replies.author: Šime Vidas
replies.message: Thanks for the info. I assumed it was way lower.

comments.author: Keyamoon
comments.message: Subpixel antialiasing adds unexpected extra pixels. It makes the font look bolder than it's supposed to. I've written about this in more detail here: https://icomoon.io/#post/455

replies.author: zachleat
replies.message: Do take note that the conclusion states “only use font-smooth overrides sparingly and as a last resort” at the end!

replies.author: Henry Bley-Vroman
replies.message: Since the default is subpixel antialiasing, that conclusion is "add unexpected pixels, except as a last resort." Is that the intention?

replies.author: zachleat
replies.message: Well, there are a couple of hoops you gotta jump through to reach that quote. Chiefly that subpixel adds “unexpected” pixels, which I don’t agree with. I think some of the context you’re probably missing here is that Keyamoon is likely seeing this conversation through the lens of icon fonts, which have a whole host of different considerations and assumptions that go along with them.
